comment.author: 91271949@N00
comment._content: Well, the Romans did build with concrete, so the baths of Caracalla where built in the time AFTER concrete was invented. It's even possible that the very building was build using concrete...

comment.author: 33595487@N05
comment._content:
The photo is very precious, I love it because I'm from Rome but I had never seen how was my city in the XVIII century! 
I think there is an error in the title because they aren't the "Bath of Caracalla", I'm sure this is the "Basilica di Massenzio", let's try to find it on Google! ;)

comment.author: 37797363@N07
comment._content: i hope that the opera aida is still staged there,anunforgetale experience.

comment.author: 23416307@N04
comment._content: Yes, These are not the baths of Caracalla, but the Basilica of Maxentius

comment.author: 13026340@N00
comment._content:
I agree, just returned from Italy and this is indeed the Basilica of Maxentius and Constantine!
A beautiful photo! Thank you!
